Method Detail

findEvents

public Event[] findEvents(RBB rbb,
                          Tagset filterTags,
                          java.lang.Double start,
                          java.lang.Double end,
                          java.lang.String soundSchema,
                          Tagset setTags)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Find RBB events determined to match the phrase specified at construction. Optionally, add specified tags on matching events.

Parameters:
rbb -
filterTags - - specifies which events to search. If null, all events with attached data in the soundSchema will be searched.
start - - limit search to events ending after this time
end - - limit search to events starting before this time
soundSchema - - name of the schema in which sound samples are stored. The file format is determined by: 1) The value of the "soundFormat" tag, if present, must name a SoundFormat. 2) The SoundFormat specified in the constructor of this object (which can be INPUTDETECT, if the sounds have a header that sox understands). 3) Otherwise, no conversion is performed - the sound format must already be sox-compliant.
setTags - - if not null, these tags will be set for each matching event. If null, the matching events are not modified.
Returns:
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

createEvents

public Event[] createEvents(RBB rbb,
                            Tagset filterTags,
                            java.lang.Double start,
                            java.lang.Double end,
                            java.lang.String soundSchema,
                            Tagset createTags)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
Create a new RBB event for each instance of the phrase detected in an existing RBB sound event. Unlike findEvents, this records the time of each recognized match, and doesn't modify the original events. Each new RBB event will have a tag, parentEvent=, where id identifies the RBB event that contains the word. (if no parentEvent tag is desired, include a null-valued parentEvent tag in createTags)

Parameters:
rbb -
filterTags - - specifies which events to search. If null, all events with attached data in the soundSchema will be searched.
start - - limit search to events ending after this time
end - - limit search to events starting before this time
soundSchema - - name of the schema in which sound samples are stored. The file format is determined by: 1) The value of the "soundFormat" tag, if present, must name a SoundFormat. 2) The SoundFormat specified in the constructor of this object (which can be INPUTDETECT, if the sounds have a header that sox understands). 3) Otherwise, no conversion is performed - the sound format must already be sox-compliant.
createTags - - if not null, these tags will be set for each newly created event.
Returns:
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
